alert.note: Alert for Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 5:22AM EDT until May 02 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following county...Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 521 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated the gauge along the Wissahickon Creek in Philadelphia has exceeded flood stage of 5.0 feet. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia and Roxborough. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 340. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
